Authors:
Thais Elias Almeida, Alexandre Salino, Jean-Yves Dubuisson,
Sabine Hennequin
Title:
Adetogramma (Polypodiaceae), a new monotypic fern genus
segregated from Polypodium
Keywords:
Andes, polygrammoid ferns, Polypodium, phylogeny,
Serpocaulon, taxonomy
Abstract:
Polypodiaceae is one of the most diverse and abundant
groups among vascular plants in tropical and subtropical forests.
Despite the several studies pertaining its phylogeny and taxonomy,
several generic boundaries within the family still need clarification.
One of the most problematic circumscriptions is that of Polypodium L.,
and one species that still contributes to the genus uncertainty is
Polypodium chrysolepis Hook. The main goal of this study was to use
molecular data to clarify the relationships of P. chrysolepis inside the
polygrammoid clade. Sequences from three plastid regions (cpDNA - rbcL,
rps4 and rps4Â–trnS IGS) from fifty species belonging to thirty-two genera
of Polypodiaceae were analyzed using maximum likelihood and bayesian
inference. Polypodium chrysolepis constitutes an isolated lineage among
the neotropical polygrammoid ferns, close to Serpocaulon and the
grammitids, and is recognized here in a new genus. It can be
distinguished by its entire leaves with free veins and peltate,
pedicellate, lanceolate paraphyses. A new combination and a complete
taxonomic treatment are presented, and conservation status was assessed
using IUCN Red List Categories and Criteria
